data.title: Anne Arundel County Government
data.text:
Sandra Lee Berkey (Knight)

Case Number: 74-045687

On July 2nd, 1974 at 10:42 a.m., the body of Sandra Lee Berkey (Knight), a 23 year old female, was found deceased in her apartment located in the 7800 block of Winborne Drive, Glen Burnie, Maryland. A co-worker found the victim after she failed to show up for work for two days. Sandra Berkey was known to frequent a gym in the Glen Burnie area of Anne Arundel County and was employed with an insurance company. Ms. Berkey’s cause of death was trauma to the body with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Roger Hearne Kelso

Case Number: 85-055625

On April 23rd, 1985, the decomposed remains of a human body were found during the excavation of the construction site of the Marley Station Mall in Glen Burnie, Md. The body was found in a metal trash container. Examinations revealed the remains were that of an unidentified white male in his mid 20’s, approx. 5’8” to 5’11” tall slim build with brown hair. He was wearing a blue and black sweater, slacks and leather shoes. It was estimated that the victim was deceased for a period of time. The unidentified male had trauma to his body with the manner being homicide.

The Anne Arundel County Police Homicide/Cold Case Unit has worked on this case for the last thirty four years in trying to positively identify the recovered remains. In the Spring of 2019 utilizing the latest forensic technology the human remains were identified as Roger Hearne Kelso. Investigation revealed Roger Kelso grew up in the 100 block of Whip Lane in Glen Burnie where he attended the Glen Burnie High School (Class of 1961). In 1962/1963 Roger Kelso left his residence and was never seen or heard from again. Evidence identifies the time frame of Roger Kelso’s murder to likely be in the period of 1962/1963.

Contact Homicide Unit

Quaniece Lashanda Orange

Case Number: 86-186685

On December 2, 1986 at 6:30 a.m., the body of 2 year old Quaniece Lashanda Orange was found by her mother in the bedroom of their apartment in the 8000 block of Green Orchard Road, Glen Burnie, Maryland. The infant was found in a comatose state and was transported to a local hospital where she passed three hours later. The cause of death for baby Orange was head trauma with the manner being homicide. Two adults and one other child resided in the apartment at the time of the death.

Contact Homicide Unit

Mary Kathleen Grant (Kathy)

Case Number: 89-017551

On January 29, 1989, the body of 15 year old Mary Kathleen Grant (Kathy) was discovered in a wooded area located off of West Pasadena Road near Jumpers Hole Road in Pasadena, Maryland. The victim resided in the 200 block of Vernon Avenue, Glen Burnie, Maryland and was a frequent runaway/hitchhiker. Ms. Grant was last seen on January 9, 1989 as she was supposed to go to an apartment in Americana Circle but never arrived. The parents of Ms. Grant reported her missing on January 19, 1989 with her body being discovered ten days later. Ms. Grant’s had sustained multiple injuries and her manner was ruled homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Gladys Faye Beauchamp

Case Number: 89-711167

On October 11, 1989 at 3:00 p.m, the body of 37 year old Gladys Faye Beauchamp was discovered in a wooded area located off of Crain Highway near Oak Manor Drive in Glen Burnie, Maryland.

Ms. Beauchamp was known to board the #14 MTA bus from Patapsco Avenue and Hanover Street at 6:00 a.m. and ride it to the corner of Crain Highway and Aquahart Road. She would then walk to the North Arundel Convalescent Center by way of an asphalt walkway that extends from Aquahart Road to the Hardees restaurant in the Southgate shopping center, and then walk the remainder of the way on Hospital Drive. On the morning of October 11, 1989, at approximately 6:10 a.m., Ms. Beauchamp was murdered while walking on this path. Ms. Beauchamp suffered trauma to the upper body with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Case Number: 91-705011

On February 6, 1991 at 12:52 p.m., unknown skeletonized human remains were located in a wooded area west of Shot Town Road near the intersection of Old Mill Bottom Road, Arnold, Maryland. The remains had been clothed in a blue or black ¾ length leather jacket with 4 purple or black buttons, long sleeved dark blue shirt (16” neck 33” inch sleeves) and one size 11 shoe. The Smithsonian Institution Department of Anthropology examined the remains and advised the victim had been deceased for approximately 1.5 to 4 years. It is unknown at this time what race the person may have been but he was approximately 5’6” tall, had dental work and was between the ages of 37-45 years of age. The unidentified remains cause of death was trauma to the upper body with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Alexandra Elizabeth Swauger

Case Number: 92-731761

On the evening of August 20, 1992 the mother of nine month old Alexandra Elizabeth Swauger went out for the evening leaving the infant with her father to care for. On August 21, 1992 at approximately 7:30 a.m., Alexandra Swauger was discovered deceased in her crib by her mother at their residence located in the 1600 block of Annapolis Road, Odenton, Maryland. An autopsy initially revealed the infant died of Sudden Infant Death Syndrome and was ruled natural. On May 5, 2000 the autopsy report was reviewed and it was at that time trauma was noted and the manner of death was changed to homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Neil Charles Fitze

Case Number: 95-743618

On October 27, 1995 at approximately 01:07 a.m., Anne Arundel County 911 Police Communications received an anonymous call reporting a male had been injured and was in a vehicle parked at North Arundel Hospital (now referred to as the Baltimore Washington Medical Center). Officers responded to the hospital located at 310 Hospital Drive, Glen Burnie, Maryland and discovered the injured male in a white vehicle. The male was identified as forty three year old Neil Charles Fitze from the 3900 block of Baltimore Annapolis Road, Baltimore, Maryland. Mr. Fitze was transported to the University of Maryland Shock Trauma Hospital where he succumbed to his injuries. Mr. Fitze suffered trauma to the upper body with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Ruth Sharlene Metcalf

Case Number: 96-714717

On April 15, 1996 at approximately 9:00 a.m., a person walking their dog discovered a body down an embankment located behind the Cromwell Field Shopping Center located in the 7300 block of Baltimore Annapolis Road, Glen Burnie, Maryland. The body was identified as thirty three year old Ruth Sharlene Metcalf from the 1500 block of Spruce Street, Baltimore, Maryland. She was fully clothed, wearing white spandex pants with multicolored flowers and a long red sweat shirt. Investigative efforts have been unable to determine if she was murdered at that spot, or if the crime occurred elsewhere and her body was disposed of there. Ms. Metcalf suffered trauma to the upper body and her death was ruled a homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Jayron Langley Speares

Case Number: 03-722708

On May 30, 2003 at approximately 7:54 p.m., officers responded for a disturbance in the 6400 block of Heritage Hill Drive and Freedom Drive, Glen Burnie, Maryland. Responding officers located a twenty three year old male suffering from non-life threatening injuries. An associate of the twenty three year old was identified as nineteen year old Jayron Langley Speares who succumbed to injuries he received during the disturbance. Investigation revealed a group of males were in a vehicle when an altercation occurred in which Mr. Speares and his associate were injured. Mr. Speares suffered trauma to the upper body with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Lamarast Alexander Porter

Case Number: 03-739810

On September 18, 2003 at approximately 1:01 a.m., officers responded to the intersection of Severn Tree Boulevard and Chatfield Terrace, Severn, Maryland for a disturbance. Upon arrival officers discovered an apparent crime scene . Witnesses observed an altercation take place at which time they reported seeing a person placed into a vehicle. Eighteen year old Lamarast Alexander Porter was last on this night and had been reported missing. On September 21, 2003 at 1:42 a.m., officers responded to the 200 block of Woodhill Drive, Glen Burnie, Maryland for a car fire. Detectives learned the vehicle on fire belonged to Mr. Porter which also displayed evidence of a crime. To date Mr. Porter has not been located and is feared to have fallen as a victim of a crime. He had graduated Meade High School in 2002 and was actively employed at a Fort Meade restaurant at the time of his disapearance.

Contact Homicide Unit

Nancy Clarke Leonard

Case Number: 03-742390

On September 5, 2003 at approximately 10:05 a.m., fifty two year old Nancy Clarke Leonard was reported missing to the Anne Arundel County Police Department. She was last seen on the evening of September 4, 2003 as she walked down the street away from her residence. On October 4, 2003 at approximately 2:25 p.m., a construction company doing some work in the area in the area of Old Mill Bottom Road, Arnold, Maryland came across human skeletal remains. Through dental records the skeletal remains were positively identifed as Mrs. Leonard. Mrs. Leonard suffered trauma to the upper body with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Nicholas David Tonic

Case Number: 03-752719

On December 10, 2003 eighteen year old Nicholas David Tonic was reported missing by his mother. During that same day Mr. Tonic’s vehicle was recovered abandoned in the 8100 block of Fruitful Court, Millersville, Maryland. The interior of the vehicle displayed evidence of a violent crime. Mr. Tonic had last been seen at his residence on December 5, 2003 in the 1700 block of Sea Pine Circle, Severn, Maryland. On January 23, 2004 at approximately 9:30 a.m., a body was discovered on the side of the road in the 7500 block of Teague Road, Hanover, Maryland. Through dental records the recovered remains were identified as Mr. Tonic. Mr. Tonic suffered trauma to the upper body with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Jonathan Edward Proctor

Case Number: 06-705237

On February 6, 2006 at approximately 7:36 a.m., Anne Arundel County Police responded to an open area in the 1800 block of Long Leaf Way, Severn, Maryland for a report of a deceased male. Officers located twenty-five year old Jonathan Edward Proctor suffering from trauma to the body where he was pronounced deceased at the scene. Detectives learned Mr. Proctor resided in Baltimore City but was in the area of the 8200 block of Coatesbridge Court, Severn, Maryland visiting as friend. A witness last reported seeing Mr. Proctor at approximately 3:00 a.m. walking down Stillmeadows Drive. Mr. Proctor suffered trauma throughout his body with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Rodreco Deonta Murray

Case Number: 06-716897

On April 29, 2006 at approximately 2:26 p.m., officers responded to the rear alley of the 5100 block of Raynor Avenue, Linthicum, Maryland for two deceased males. One victim was identified as twenty-eight year old Rodreco Deonta Murray and was located on the ground next to a vehicle. The second victim was identified as twenty-seven year old Lawrence Jerome Forrester who was found deceased inside a vehicle. Investigation revealed Mr. Murray and Mr. Forrester were friends and known to be in each others company. Mr. Forrester was last known to speak to a witness at approximately 2:00 p.m. from his cellphone. Both Mr. Murray and Mr. Forrester suffered trauma to their bodies with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Lawrence Jerome Forrester

Case Number: 06-716897

On April 29, 2006 at approximately 2:26 p.m., officers responded to the rear alley of the 5100 block of Raynor Avenue, Linthicum, Maryland for two deceased males. One victim was identified as twenty-eight year old Rodreco Deonta Murray and was located on the ground next to a vehicle. The second victim was identified as twenty-seven year old Lawrence Jerome Forrester who was found deceased inside a vehicle. Investigation revealed Mr. Murray and Mr. Forrester were friends and known to be in each others company. Mr. Forrester was last known to speak to a witness at approximately 2:00 p.m. from his cellphone. Both Mr. Murray and Mr. Forrester suffered trauma to their bodies with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Dequincy Antonio Smith

Case Number: 07-736197

On Tuesday, August 28, 2007 at approximately 8:46 p.m., officers responded to the 200 block of Southerly Road, Baltimore, Maryland for two injured males. The victims were identified as twenty-three year old Dequincy Antonio Smith and twenty-one year old Dontay Williams both from Baltimore Maryland. Mr. Smith was pronounced deceased at the scene where Mr. Williams was transported to the University of Maryland Shock Trauma Hospital where he later succumbed to his injuries. Witnesses reported two suspects entered the residence and inflicted trauma to both victims before fleeing in a vehicle parked outside. Both Mr. Smith and Mr. Williams suffered trauma to their bodies with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Dontay Williams

Case Number: 07-736197

On Tuesday, August 28, 2007 at approximately 8:46 p.m., officers responded to the 200 block of Southerly Road, Baltimore, Maryland for two injured males. The victims were identified as twenty-three year old Dequincy Antonio Smith and twenty-one year old Dontay Williams both from Baltimore Maryland. Mr. Smith was pronounced deceased at the scene where Mr. Williams was transported to the University of Maryland Shock Trauma Hospital where he later succumbed to his injuries. Witnesses reported two suspects entered the residence and inflicted trauma to both victims before fleeing in a vehicle parked outside. Both Mr. Smith and Mr. Williams suffered trauma to their bodies with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Myra Elizabeth Cason

Case Number: 11-703396

On January 28, 2011 at approximately 10:51 am, officers from the Anne Arundel County Police responded to the parking lot of in the 7300 block of Ritchie Highway in Glen Burnie for an unresponsive adult female. Officers located Myra Elizabeth Cason inside her 1994 Suzuki Sidekick suffering from apparent trauma to the upper body. Ms. Cason was 63 years old and a retired Anne Arundel County School Teacher. She was seen leaving Maryland Primary Care Physicians at approximately 7:50 a.m. and arrived on the parking lot at approximately 8:30 a.m. where she was found. Ms. Cason suffered trauma to the upper body with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Gregory Robert Sears

Case Number: 12-700620

On January 6, 2018 at approximately 2:15 a.m., Gregory Robert Sears was assaulted after an apparent robbery attempt in the 8000 block of Ians Ally, Laurel, Maryland. Mr. Sears was accosted by two black males, both wearing dark clothes. One suspect was described over six foot tall with a thin build; the second suspect was described as being shorter. The subjects may have left the area in an unknown vehicle. Mr. Sears, a thirty-six year old male, was transported to the University of Maryland Shock Trauma Hospital for treatment, but later succumbed to his injuries. Mr. Sears’ death was ruled a homicide. Shortly after his murder, Mr. Sears’ wife gave birth to their child.

Contact Homicide Unit

Ana Isabel Racine

Case Number: 14-70326

On January 25, 2014 just before midnight, the Anne Arundel County Police responded to the 200 block of Meadow Road in Pasadena, Maryland regarding the murder of Ana Isabel Racine. Ms. Racine, a twenty-one year old female, had just returned to the Pasadena area after spending two years living in Georgia. Within hours of returning back to Anne Arundel County she reunited with friends and met up with a male acquaintance. It was shortly thereafter they were accosted by two suspects who attacked the victim and her acquaintance and subsequently shot the victim. The suspects may have fled in a dark colored minivan. Ms. Racine’s death was ruled a homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Leticia Perez

Case Number: 14-729162

On July 31, 2014 at approximately 4:48 p.m., Anne Arundel County Police responded to the 400 block of Kokomo Court, Laurel, Maryland for an eleven month old infant in respiratory distress. The infant, Leticia Perez, had been at an in home daycare prior to being transported to the Childrens Hospital in Washington DC. Within days of being hospitalized baby Perez succumbed to her injuries. \The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner said the cause was trauma to the upper body with the manner being homicide. It is unknown exactly where the trauma occurred as the victim had ties to Randallstown in Baltimore County, Laurel in Howard County and the day care in Anne Arundel County.

Contact Homicide Unit

Shannon Blair Jr.

Case Number: 15-735117

On Tuesday, September 15, 2015 at approximately 8:00 p.m., Anne Arundel County Police Officers were dispatched for a shots fired call to the area of Washington Avenue and Bay Highlands Drive, Annapolis, Maryland. As officers were responding, a citizen called and advised they saw what appeared to be a body near the roadway. Responding officers located an adult male lying on the roadway with apparent trauma. Fire Department personnel responded to the scene and eventually pronounced the victim deceased after succumbing to his injuries. The victim was positively identified as Shannon Blair Jr., a twenty-nine year old male from the 10th block of Hicks Avenue, Annapolis, Maryland. On Wednesday, September 16, 2015, the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner determined Mr. Blair’s cause of death as gunshot wounds with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Michael John Compton

Case Number: 15-715443

On Friday, September 18, 2015 at approximately 1:18 a.m., the Anne Arundel County Police Department responded to the area of Arundel Village Park, Brooklyn, Anne Arundel County, Maryland. The park is located in the area of Wasena Avenue and Alley 69 which borders Baltimore City. Responding patrol units were directed by witnesses to an area of the park where an injured adult male was discovered lying on the path suffering from apparent gunshot wounds. Fire Department personnel responded to the scene and transported the victim to the University of Maryland Shock Trauma Hospital for treatment of his injuries. The victim, identified as Michael John Compton, a twenty-one year old male known to stay in the 5000 block of Patrick Henry Drive, Baltimore, Maryland, later succumbed to his injuries. Investigation revealed Mr. Compton was in the area to conduct a business transaction when he was shot. Michael Compton’s death has been ruled a homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Teyon Decarlos Jones

Case Number: 11-729756

On Sunday, August 7, 2011 at approximately 2:22 a.m., Anne Arundel County Police Western District officers responded to the 2000 block of Lower Court, Crofton, Maryland for a shots fired complaint. Upon arrival officers learned through investigation a party was held in the area and during the party shots were fired. While doing a search for any victims or witnesses, officers located an apparent crime scene in the 1800 block of Judicial Way, Crofton, Maryland indicating an individual had received an injury.

While officers were on scene, a Northern District officer had been dispatched to the Baltimore Washington Medical Center at approximately 2:38 a.m. on an unrelated 911 call. Upon arrival paramedics instructed the officer that a gunshot victim had just been driven to the hospital by three individuals. The officer located the victim, identified as Teyon Decarlos Jones a twenty-two year old male from the 8000 block of Phirne Road, Glen Burnie, Maryland suffering from an apparent gunshot wound(s) to the upper body. Mr. Jones was later transported to the University of Maryland Shock Trauma Hospital for treatment of his injuries. Due to his injuries, Mr. Jones quality of life had been adversely affected.

On Saturday, November 21, 2015, while under medical care, Teyon Jones was pronounced deceased at 8:20 p.m. The body of Mr. Jones was then transported to the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner located in Baltimore Maryland so an autopsy could determine the exact cause and manner of death. On Sunday, November 22, 2015, the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner ruled the cause of Teyon Jones death as complications from the gunshot wound received on August 7, 2011 with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Arnold Lee Bowman

Case Number: 16-708666

On Thursday, January 7, 2016 at approximately 8:30 p.m., Anne Arundel County Northern District officers responded to the area of Ritchie Highway and Belle Grove Road, Baltimore, Maryland for a male who had been assaulted. A forty-four year old male, identified as Arnold Lee Bowman of the 200 block of Charles Street, Baltimore, Maryland was found unresponsive in an alley. Fire Department personnel rendered aid and transported the victim to the University of Maryland Shock Trauma Hospital for treatment of his injuries.

Surveillance footage was recovered in the area that shows the suspect chasing the victim. The suspect is seen wearing a hoody styled sweatshirt and long pants at the time of the assault. Mr. Bowman remained hospitalized since the attack and on March 25, 2016 he had succumbed to his injuries while in the care of a medical facility. The Office of the Chief Medical Examiner located in Baltimore Maryland performed an autopsy on Mr. Bowman where they ruled the cause of death as multiple wounds with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Darrell Antonio Blowe and Kesa Kibibi Baker

Case Number: 17-738670

On Wednesday, October 4, 2017 at approximately 4:44 p.m., Anne Arundel County Northern District officers responded to the 5100 block of Patrick Henry Drive, Brooklyn, Maryland for a motor vehicle accident. Upon arrival officers located a silver vehicle on fire that had crashed through a fence and had come to rest against a garage. Officers were able to quickly extinguish the flames and observed an unresponsive adult male driver and adult female passenger. Evidence at the scene indicated the occupants of the vehicle had been shot. Fire department personnel arrived on scene and declared both occupants deceased.

On Thursday, October 5, 2017, the OCME completed the autopsies on both victims and determined the cause of death as multiple gunshot wounds with the manner being homicide. The adult male was identified as Darrell Antonio Blowe, a thirty-four year old male from the 700 block of Peach Orchard Lane, Dundalk, Maryland. The female victim was identified as Kesa Kibibi Baker, a forty-four year old female from the 500 block of Baltic Avenue, Baltimore Maryland.

Contact Homicide Unit

Lawrence Aaron III

Case Number: 18-700007

On Monday, January 1, 2018 at approximately 1:06 a.m., Anne Arundel County Police were called to the 7800 block of Bastille Road, Severn, Maryland for a shooting. Lawrence Aaron III was identified as a victim in which the shooting left this Marshall University Player paralyzed. Lawrence Aaron III, nineteen years old, of Columbia, Maryland, was shot on Jan. 1 at a New Year’s Eve party in Severn, south of Baltimore. Mr. Aaron was a freshman defensive tackle at Marshall University in Huntington, West Virginia. On Thursday, February 22, 2018 Lawrence Aaron III died from complications of being shot and his death was ruled a homicide. The New Year’s Eve party contained people from throughout Maryland and surrounding states..

Contact Homicide Unit

Jose Alberto Funes

Case Number: 18-708168

On Friday, March 2, 2018 at approximately 7:14 a.m., Anne Arundel County Western District officers responded to the 200 block of Brock Bridge Road Laurel, Maryland for a report of a sick/injured subject. Upon arrival officers located an injured adult male seated inside a vehicle on Brock Bridge Road. The male was suffering from trauma to the upper body. Fire department personnel attempted to render medical aid to the victim, however he had succumbed to his injuries and was pronounced deceased. The victim was positively identified as Jose Alberto Funes a twenty-two year old male who resided in the 1000 block of Keppel Harbour Pasadena, Maryland. The victim was transported to the Office of the Chief Medical Examiner where the autopsy revealed he suffered trauma to the upper body and his death was ruled a homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Jason Erol Armetta

Case Number: 09-706112

On Sunday, February 15, 2009 at approximately 12:58 a.m., officers responded for a shooting coming from the 7300 block of Parkway Drive South, Hanover, Maryland. Upon arrival officers encountered the victim, identified as Jason Erol Armetta, a twenty-four year old male from the 10000 block of Old Frederick Road, Ellicott City, Maryland. The victim suffered from gunshot wound(s) and was transported to the University of Maryland Shock Trauma Hospital for treatment of his injuries.

Investigation revealed an adult female was hosting a 19th birthday party for herself. Through interviews with witnesses a group of three unknown African American males entered the party. It was at this time an argument occurred between the three males and Jason Armetta. During the argument one of the males produced a handgun and shot Mr. Armetta. Since being shot, Mr. Armetta received medical care throughout the years for his injuries he received. On Friday, September 28, 2018, at approximately 2:25 p.m., Jason Armetta was pronounced deceased. The OCME ruled Mr. Armetta’s cause of death as complications from the gunshot wound(s) with the manner being homicide.

Contact Homicide Unit

Andre Lee Garrett

Case Number: 19-741565

On Wednesday, October 30, 2019 at approximately 3:09 p.m., Anne Arundel County Eastern District Officers responded to the 300 block of Hospital Drive, Glen Burnie, Maryland for a shooting. Upon arrival officers located an adult male victim being treated by medical personnel. The victim, identified as Andre Lee Garrett, a thirty-nine year old male from the 1400 block of Iverson Street, Oxon Hill, Maryland, was transported to the Baltimore Washington Medical Center where he later succumbed to his injuries.

Mr. Garrett was an employee of the business and was outside taking a break. During the break the suspect pointed a handgun at the victim striking and killing him. The suspect was described as a male wearing a black baseball hat, a long sleeved white shirt with a short sleeve dark colored shirt over it appearing to be 5'06, thin build with wavy shoulder length hair. After the shooting the suspect walked from the area. Investigation revealed the suspect may have entered a silver car parked in the parking lot and drove from the scene.

Contact Homicide Unit

Michael Lee Wise

Case Number: 19-741733

On Thursday, October 31, 2019 at approximately 7:20 p.m., officers responded to the 400 block of Gatewood Ct, Glen Burnie, Maryland for a shooting. Upon arrival officers located the victim, Michael Lee Wise, a twenty-four year old male, laying on the sidewalk, suffering trauma to the upper body. CPR was administered at the scene. The victim was pronounced deceased at the scene by the Fire Department. The medical examiner ruled Mr. Wise’s cause of death as multiple guns shot wounds with the manner being homicide.

Investigation revealed Mr. Wise was in a costume trick-or-treating with his girlfriend and her family. He was pushing a stroller with his child in it when the suspect shot and killed Mr. Wise. Investigation showed two subjects running from the area after the shooting occurred.

Contact Homicide Unit

Xavier John Arthur Green

Case Number: 19-744165

On Monday, November 18, 2019 at approximately 6:03 p.m., Anne Arundel County Northern District Officers responded to the 300 block of Morris Hill Avenue, Glen Burnie, Maryland for a shooting. Upon arrival officers located an unresponsive adult male victim. Responding officers began CPR on the victim until relieved by medical personnel. The victim, identified as Xavier John Arthur Green, a twenty-eight year old male from the 300 block of Morris Hill Avenue, Glen Burnie, Maryland, was declared deceased at the scene due to his injuries. The OCME ruled Xavier Green’s cause of death as multiple gunshot wounds with the manner being homicide.

Investigation revealed an African American male knocked on the door to the residence and asked for the victim. Shortly after the victim went outside with the male several shots were heard. Responding police and family members located the victim on the property. The shooter is described as an African American male wearing a light colored shirt with dark pants.

Contact Homicide Unit

Justin Keith Beasley (Junior)

Case Number: 20-720799

On Sunday, July 5, 2020 at approximately 12:40 a.m., the Anne Arundel County Police Department responded to the 1600 block of Cananaro Drive, Annapolis, Maryland for a shooting. Upon arrival, officers encountered a large crowd of people from a fourth of July party taking place and two gunshot victims.

The first victim was identified as nineteen year old Justin Keith Beasley (Junior) from North Carolina. First responders administered cardiopulmonary resuscitation. Mr. Beasley was transported to a local hospital where he succumbed to his injuries.

The second victim was identified as a nineteen year old male. That victim was transported to a local trauma center for treatment of his injuries. The second victim has since been released from the hospital.

The Anne Arundel County Police is offering a REWARD of up to $10,000.00 for information leading to the arrest and conviction of the suspect(s) involved in the murder of Justin Beasley (Junior) and shooting of the second victim.

Contact Homicide Unit
